description:
We are seeking a GenAI Data Content Rater (German Language) for a 3-month contract .



Key Responsibilities:

- Collaborate with GenAI researchers and engineers to understand data collection and evaluation requirements.
- Translate high-level requirements into detailed workflows and communicate them to the team.
- Execute data collection and evaluation workflows efficiently with minimal supervision.
- Innovate and optimize data collection workflows to maximize efficiency.
- Conduct in-depth research using LLM models and gather reliable domain-specific information.
- Evaluate and provide feedback on original and curated content for LLM evaluation and training.
- Judge model responses to complex problems to ensure accuracy and informativeness.
- Perform fact-checking and accuracy verification to maintain data integrity.

Required Qualifications & Experience:

- Native/Bilingual or Full Professional Proficiency in reading and writing German
- Graduate with distinction and strong cultural knowledge.
- Degree from a top-tier US or international university/institute.
- Exceptional reading and writing proficiency in Thai with mastery of grammar, syntax, and style.
- Strong research and fact-checking skills with high attention to detail.
- Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
- Foundational understanding of AI/LLMs, NLP, and related concepts.
- Experience with AI tools and prompt review.
- Awareness of ethical AI practices and strong data literacy.

- Role: Freelance AI Data Specialist
- Location: Ireland
- Compensation: Earn up to $10,000 Per Month



About the Role

Join a worldwide community of skilled professionals outsmarting AI with human creativity and analytical brilliance. As a Data Contributor, you will directly influence the quality and safety of cutting-edge language models, including collaborations with industry-standard partners.



Responsibilities

- Evaluate and rank outputs from large language models by reviewing reasoning, problem-solving, and response quality.
- Develop professional-level prompts and critique AI-generated content with user-centric thinking.
- Contribute to a variety of AI projects determined by your skill sets and expertise.



Requirements

- Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher (or currently enrolled).
- Demonstrated analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills.
- Clear and engaging writing style with attention to detail and technical precision.



Community & Growth

- Join an international team of coding and data experts.
- Influence enterprise adoption of advanced models like Llama in partnership with Scale AI and Meta.

job title: (Junior) Litigation Lawyer for Airline Passengers Claims
description:
*Please, only apply if you have a valid Attorney at Law license and are authorised to practise law by the Regulation Authority in PORTUGAL and you have litigation experience in Portugal.*



Instead of a CV, please attach a simple Word file describing your experience in airline passenger claims under EU261/2004 or baggage claims under Montreal Convention in English.



About Us

‚úàÔ∏èAt AirAdvisor , we are dedicated to ensuring air travelers receive the compensation they are entitled to for flight disruptions. Whether it‚Äôs a delay, cancellation, missed connection , or an airline-related issue like overbooking . In June 2025, we introduced a new service for baggage claims related to lost, delayed, or destroyed luggage . We are present in the EU, the UK, and other international markets, with a focus on protecting air passenger rights globally. We have successfully processed over 530,000 claims for clients from 221 countries , earning a 4.7-star rating based on over 27,800 reviews . Currently operating in 21 languages (with nine more forthcoming this year), AirAdvisor is an ambitious and fast-growing startup with a clear vision for international expansion. We plan to reach 1 million claims by the end of 2026. ‚úàÔ∏è



We are seeking a skilled and dedicated Litigation Lawyer specializing in consumer flight claims (typically via small claims procedures) to lead in-court collections. Pre-court collections are managed by a team of paralegals. You will be responsible for filing batches of court cases to collect compensation and/or reimbursement of Out-of-Pocket Expenses (OPE) incurred by passengers and/or recover ticket refunds. AirAdvisor currently handles three types of airline claims: EU261 compensation for flight delays, cancellations, and denied boarding, as well as two types of baggage claims under the Montreal Convention: lost and delayed luggage.



If the law or a judge decides the case unfairly, we would consider escalating this to change the law, if feasible. There may be PR opportunities to highlight court victories and key legal issues that deserve public attention. This is an excellent opportunity for high performers who can self-perform, have strong litigation experience, and have a passion for advocating consumer rights in the airline industry.



The candidate must be free from conflicts of interest, meaning they are free to litigate claims against different airlines.



Requirements:

- A valid Attorney at Law license in Portugal and professional liability insurance.
- A law degree from an accredited institution.
- Experience with small claims, consumer rights, or aviation law is a plus, but is not required.
- Knowledge of relevant consumer protection laws and aviation regulations is a plus, but is not required.
- Proven track record of success in in-court collection.
- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to assess case merits, conduct legal research, and develop effective legal strategies.
- Ability to manage a caseload, prioritize tasks, meet deadlines, and track statute of limitations.
- Experience in automating and standardizing claims management processes to scale up quickly.



Responsibilities:

- Act as the legal representative of AirAdvisor in Portugal , handling all legal matters and claims filed within the jurisdiction. If setting up a law firm in Portugal were feasible, you would be expected to assist in this matter, including, but not limited to, corporate structuring, registering Mr. Anton Radchenko on the official list of foreign legal counsels in Portugal, and other formalities.
- Pre-court collections and out-of-court settlements.
- Prepare and file batches of approx. 200+ legal new claims monthly in Portuguese courts against various airlines for the purpose of recovering:

(a) Compensation under EU Regulation 261/2004 and/or Turkish SHY Regulation for flight delays, cancellations, and denied boarding.

(b) Reimbursement of out-of-pocket expenses incurred by passengers under EU261/2004, and/or the Montreal Convention.

(c) Ticket refunds owed to passengers under applicable legal frameworks.

(d) Handle baggage-related claims , including cases of delayed, damaged, or lost luggage, in accordance with the provisions of the Montreal Convention and/or Warsaw Convention.

- Respond comprehensively and assertively to airline legal defenses , including substantive arguments as well as procedural and jurisdictional challenges.
- Lead the enforcement of court judgments , including initiating enforcement proceedings and coordinating with bailiffs or enforcement authorities when necessary.
- Engage in court-led settlement negotiations , and where applicable, represent AirAdvisor‚Äôs interests in securing favorable in-court settlements.
- Maintain complete and accurate legal case files , ensuring all work complies with Portuguese legal ethics, data protection regulations, and professional standards. Conduct thorough legal research and comparative analysis to compile best practices for managing recurring legal issues in airline and consumer rights litigation.
- Stay informed about developments in consumer protection law , aviation regulations, EU regulations, and judicial precedents in order to provide updated, authoritative legal advice and representation.
- Where applicable, and if a court decision is rendered unjustly, pursue legal remedies, including appeals , and advocate for legislative changes , if strategically and procedurally feasible.
- Support the optimization and automation of claims management workflows , leveraging legal technology solutions, including AI-based tools, to improve efficiency and scalability.
- Identify and propose new civil claims business opportunities that are viable under Portuguese law and offer low-value, high-volume litigation potential. Areas may include, but are not limited to:

(a) Bank and financial disputes, Labour law-related claims, etc.

(b) Conduct cross-jurisdictional legal research , primarily across EU and UK markets, to identify relevant precedents and advanced practices that may be adapted for use in Portugal in more complex claim scenarios.

- Represent AirAdvisor in local media , including giving interviews to press outlets, television broadcasters, and podcast programs. Coordinate with AirAdvisor‚Äôs PR Manager to take advantage of public relations opportunities surrounding landmark court rulings or critical legal developments, with the goal of enhancing public awareness of consumer rights.
- Review and vet content as needed, aka serve as in-country content reviewer of record to help build local trust and boost authority.
- Advocate for passenger and consumer rights within the airline and travel industry, promoting fair treatment and legal protection for air travellers.



Soft skills:

- Professional, ambitious, and open to testing new AI optimization solutions and new approaches to the claims management process.
- Self-aware , honest , and able to take responsibility for mistakes while driving continuous improvement.
- Result-oriented , with a proven ability to deliver fast and make a significant impact on business.
- A results-driven approach , demonstrating initiative and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
- Exceptional problem-solving skills and creative thinking abilities.
- Independent, able to act as a universal player, capable of working independently without constant supervision.
- Devotion , eager to make a significant impact on customer satisfaction, with a willingness to go above and beyond to achieve his goals.
- Excellent communication skills , with the ability to articulate complex ideas clearly and concisely.



We offer:

- Remote-first culture with flexible start and end times. Your working hours will be easily registered in our time-tracking application, allowing you to adjust your working day according to your needs and capacities.
- Paid Time Off & Public Holidays ‚Äì because work-life balance matters.
- Annual pay review and performance-based bonuses.
- Professional Growth Opportunities ‚Äì work on a global expansion and new market entry.
- Dynamic work and a chance to learn how to utilize your skills in an absolutely new way.
- Supportive Team Culture ‚Äì Work with smart, passionate, and friendly colleagues who value collaboration.
- International Team - our colleagues are located in 13 countries around the globe.



Job Type : Indefinite-term Freelancing Contract / Service Agreement or a B2B Contract.



If you're ready to take on a high-impact role in a fast-growing company, apply now, and let's fight for airline passenger rights globally!



Our Recruitment Process:

- Application screening: If your profile matches our current business needs, our Talent Acquisition Manager will invite you to the HR interview.
- HR interview : Please do research about our company and industry, and be prepared to discuss your achievements. If you wish, you can send us a summary of your achievements in advance of the interview, so we can better prepare for the conversation.
- Interview with the CEO: Our CEO will discuss your functional experience, achievements, and technical skills in more detail.



‚úàÔ∏è Join us and bring LegalTech & TravelTech innovation to the next level! ‚úàÔ∏è



If you would like to be the first one to know about our new job openings, company business updates, new services, rankings related to the airports, airlines, and aviation industry, please follow our LinkedIn company page and our social media profiles.

üì¢ Opportunit√† di collaborazione ‚Äì Docenti per corsi di formazione online (FAD)



Siamo alla ricerca di professionisti qualificati per attivit√† di docenza online (in FAD) nell‚Äôambito di un percorso formativo della durata di 40 ore per ciascun modulo.



üéØ Aree di docenza richieste:

- Marketing turistico
- Gestione strutture ricettive
- Graphic designer
- Informatica
- Ambiente e responsabilit√† sociale
- Cucina
- Sartoria

BetterHelp ‚Äì Join the World‚Äôs Largest Online Therapy Platform!

At BetterHelp, we are on a mission to break down barriers to therapy and make mental health support accessible to everyone. Since our founding in 2013, we have become the world‚Äôs largest online therapy service, offering affordable and convenient therapy in 210 countries. We are looking for a group of qualified counselors and therapists to join our network for our EU launch in the Netherlands.



New Dutch Providers are eligible for up to ‚Ç¨1,000 in first-month bonuses*.



Benefits of Joining BetterHelp:

- Work with a world-class organization during our expansion in Europe.
- All-in-one platform : Handle your sessions seamlessly without worrying about client acquisition, billing, or administrative tasks‚Äîwe handle it all for you!
- Flexibility : Conduct therapy sessions from anywhere, with the support of a leading global platform.
- Specialized client populations : Focus on the areas you're most passionate about.
- Zero overhead: No fees are ever collected from the counselor.
- Autonomy over clinical decisions : You are the qualified and trained counselor. BetterHelp will defer to your clinical judgment and expertise about the most effective and clinically appropriate approach for each client.
- Resources to support you: Counselors on the BetterHelp platform receive a free BetterHelp account ‚Äì so you can dedicate time to your own self-care!
- Competitive compensation and bonuses : ‚Ç¨1,000 when you take your first client within 30 days of applying. First client bonuses are subject to change, so now is a great time to join!



Who Should Apply:

- Counselors looking for the flexibility to conduct teletherapy from anywhere.
- Counselors who want to focus on clinical work‚Äîwe take care of client acquisition, billing, and support.
- Counselors who are interested in working with specific populations or concerns.



Requirements:

- Credentialed to practice as a WO-psycholoog (university education psychologist), Integrative Counselor, Psychosocial Counselor or Psychosocial Therapist.
- 3+ years of experience counseling adults.
- Ability to maintain a private environment for conducting therapy sessions.
- Must pass a background check.
- A reliable internet connection for teletherapy.
- Must be able to speak/write and conduct therapy in German.



Counselors are not BetterHelp employees but independent contractors. The use of the word ‚Äúbonus‚Äù refers to an incentive provided to independent contractors. It does not imply an employment relationship nor entitle any independent contractors to employee benefits.

*New providers in the Netherlands may also qualify for up to ‚Ç¨1,000 bonus if certain terms and conditions are met.

‚Ä¢ Create engaging content for Instagram, TikTok, Pinterest, and other platforms

L'attivit√† pu√≤ essere svolta da remoto.

Job Description



Role Type: Contract

Duration: 6 ‚Äì 9 months

Work Hours: local time business hours

Location: Netherlands, UK

Hourly Rate: up to $70/hr. EUR



Our Story & Purpose



At Burwood Group, we‚Äôre more than a technology consulting firm, we‚Äôre a team of innovators, problem-solvers, and collaborators who help organizations turn technology into meaningful business outcomes. Founded in 1997 and headquartered in Oak Brook, IL, we‚Äôve grown into a nationwide team of experts committed to making a real difference.



Our purpose starts with Customer Focus. We put our clients at the center of everything we do - listening, understanding their challenges, and delivering solutions that drive impact.



We believe in ownership, collaboration, and growth. Our people aren‚Äôt just employees; they are innovators shaping the future of our clients‚Äô success. At Burwood, you‚Äôll work alongside talented professionals, tackle exciting challenges, and develop skills that elevate your career. If you‚Äôre ready to make an impact, learn continuously, and grow within a culture that values your unique strengths, Burwood Group is the place for you.



How You‚Äôll Make an Impact



Burwood Group is seeking a contract Technical Project Manager to contribute to a client engagement within the logistics and freight sector, based in either the Netherlands or the United Kingdom. This position is integral to an ongoing initiative, working alongside a senior team member and providing support for system cutovers.



To be successful, you bring expertise in application development, with a particular focus on migration projects involving Transportation Management Systems (TMS). You will also be responsible for managing smaller-scale or standardized projects, ensuring effective planning and execution of project scope.



Additionally, you will be responsible for:



- Supporting Project Managers and/or Technical Leads in larger-scale initiatives via task coordination, project reporting, project documentation, and meeting scribe.
- Track the status of project tasks, schedules, and milestones, and provide relevant updates to the project team.
- Handle administrative tasks as necessary on internal and client projects to keep individual contributors focused on production work.
- Serve as application SME and administrative owner for internal time, resource, and invoice management system.
- Foster communication and transparency among all teams involved in project delivery, including clients.



Your Strengths in Action



- Strong background in Technical Project Management, including experience leading cross-functional teams through complex initiatives.
- Deep understanding and hands-on experience with Agile methodologies, particularly Scrum.
- Highly detail-oriented and organized, with excellent time management and multitasking skills.
- Demonstrated ability to manage third-party vendors and external partners effectively (Vendor Management).
- Ability to provide high levels of adaptability and flexibility in supporting evolving work needs.
- Possible need to support on-site activity AND potential for weekend work support.



Preferred (Optional) Qualifications:

- Strongly preferred experience within the logistics/freight sector.
- Familiarity with or experience in Digital Operations, including tools, workflows, and optimization strategies.
- Experience working in B2B and/or B2C environments.



Belonging & Culture



We are not intent on being the largest company, but rather the best. These are the words we live by. We welcome top talent, regardless of gender, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability, religion, or age.



By embracing all cultural backgrounds, life experiences, perspectives, and ideas, we not only continue to strengthen our company culture, but also foster innovation and drive organizational success. We believe that diversity fuels creativity and enables us to deliver exceptional results for our clients.

job title: Freelance Peer Reviewer - Vaccine clinical trials
description:
- Doctorate (PhD/MD) or equivalent advanced degree in the subject area.
- At least two publications in the last two years in your field.
- Thorough understanding of research methodologies and ethical principles within the relevant discipline.
- Excellent analytical and critical thinking skills.
- Strong written communication skills with the ability to provide clear, concise, and constructive feedback.
- Ability to adhere to deadlines and manage time effectively.
- Commitment to maintaining confidentiality and objectivity.
- Prior experience as a peer reviewer for academic journals is highly desirable.
- Familiarity with online manuscript submission and review systems.

- Assess Novelty: Assess whether the manuscript is original and adds new knowledge or insights to the field of study.
- Evaluate Study Design and Methodology: Assess whether the study design and methods are appropriate, comprehensive, and clearly described to ensure that the research can be accurately reproduced in the future.
- Literature Review: Check whether the manuscript thoroughly incorporates and cites relevant, up-to-date research in the field.
- Analyse Results and Conclusions: Evaluates whether the results are presented clearly and appropriately, and whether the conclusions are supported by the data and significant to the field.
- Providing Constructive Feedback: Provide constructive feedback, suggesting improvements or highlighting any flaws, omissions, or ethical concerns.
- Recommend Publication: Based on your evaluation, the journal editor will decide whether the manuscript should be accepted, revised, or rejected.

job title: Docent Systeembeheer, Utrecht - lesdag: dinsdag, start: per direct
description:
Wil jij als docent Expert IT Systems & Devices deel uitmaken van een bevlogen onderwijsteam van Capabel Onderwijs?



Locatie: Utrecht, Australi√´laan 14-16

Lesdag: dinsdag en/of woensdag

Lestijden: 09.00-17.00 uur, klassikaal

Frequentie: wekelijks

Ingangsdatum: per direct

Dienstverband: Tijdelijk met uitzicht op verlenging



Voor de locatie in Utrecht zijn wij op zoek naar een enthousiaste en inspirerende docent voor een groep niveau 4 studenten. Deze studenten worden op een praktijkgerichte manier opgeleid om het werkveld te betreden. Er is √©√©n vaste lesdag op school. De overige tijd besteden studenten aan zelfstudie, e-learning, stage of werkervaring.



Als docent verzorg je √©√©n dag per week beroepsgerichte vakken met thema‚Äôs zoals: IT- netwerken, IT-infrastructuur, apps, mobiele apparaten en software omtrent installatie, onderhouden, monitoren en storingen oplossen.



Wat verwachten we van jou?

- Je hebt bij voorkeur een afgeronde Hbo-opleiding
- Je hebt voldoende praktijkervaring
- Je bent stressbestendig en je weet de studenten te enthousiasmeren en te inspireren
- Je draagt bij aan een positief en veilig werkklimaat
- Je haalt er voldoening uit om de studenten jouw praktijkkennis mee te geven
- Je blijft graag op de hoogte van de ontwikkelingen binnen je vakgebied



Dit bieden wij

- Een warm welkom: Nieuwe collega‚Äôs krijgen een warm welkom, zodat jij je zo snel mogelijk bij ons thuis voelt en een optimale voorbereiding krijgt
- Nieuwe docenten krijg bij ons een buddy toegewezen, dat is een ervaren docent van Capabel waar je op kunt terugvallen zodat je er niet alleen voor komt te staan
- Aandacht voor jou: We vinden het belangrijk dat je het beste uit jezelf kunt halen. Zo is er bijvoorbeeld budget om een onderwijsminor te halen
- Een enthousiast, betrokken en bevlogen team, waar plezier en van elkaar leren centraal staat
- Nieuwe docenten krijg bij ons een buddy toegewezen, dat is een ervaren docent van Capabel waar je op kunt terugvallen zodat je er niet alleen voor komt te staan
- Vakgroepoverleggen om vakinhoudelijke kennis te delen
- Mogelijkheid om bij te dragen aan de ontwikkeling en vernieuwing van het onderwijs
- Een bruto maandsalaris van maximaal ‚Ç¨3.250 o.b.v. 40 uur, gebaseerd op je ervaring
- Een tijdelijk contract met uitzicht op verlenging
- 12 lesvrije weken/vakantie
- 8% vakantiegeld
- Mogelijkheden tot het volgen van opleidingen en trainingen via onze eigen Calder Academy
- Pensioen via Zwitserleven
- Aantrekkelijk fietsplan
- Een bijdrage aan een fitnessabonnement via Bedrijfsfitness Nederland (3195 aangesloten sportlocaties)
- Reiskostenvergoeding (OV volledig, auto max 60km per dag, oftewel maximaal ‚Ç¨13,80 per dag)



Capabel Onderwijs heeft geen CAO.



Over Capabel

Capabel Onderwijs verzorgt online en op diverse locaties Mbo-, branche erkend en Taalonderwijs binnen de sectoren Zorg & Welzijn, Horeca, Financieel & Administratief, HR & Juridisch, Marketing & Communicatie, Commercieel & Ondernemen en Logistiek. De Mbo-opleidingen zijn erkend door het Ministerie van Onderwijs, de vakopleidingen zijn branche- of wettelijk erkend. Uniek aan ons Mbo-programma is dat deze opleidingen maar 52 lesweken duren met een looptijd van 9-15 maanden. Werken bij Capabel Onderwijs is werken bij een innovatieve en actieve organisatie. Capabel Onderwijs loopt voorop in de ontwikkeling van verkorte en erkende opleidingen voor volwassenen. Bij ons werken professionals die hun vak verstaan en trots zijn op ons bedrijf. Samen werken we aan de toekomst van onze studenten.



Bij Capabel Onderwijs werken ruim 200 medewerkers. Capabel Onderwijs maakt onderdeel uit van Calder Holding, een bundeling van bedrijven in de domeinen Onderwijs, Zorg en Werk.



Ge√Ønteresseerd?

Heeft bovenstaande jou voldoende getriggerd om met ons kennis te maken? Klik om te solliciteren.



Wil je eerst meer inhoudelijke informatie? Benader dan Kirsten Simons (Recruiter Capabel Onderwijs) via 06-51755754.



Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.



Note: A thorough understanding of the Dutch language is mandatory

- Provide oversight of vendor resources within Portugal, Spain, Andorra, Italy, San Marino, Vatican City, Greece and Cyprus.
- Support the Area Safety Head in providing relevant local information for the European Economic Area Pharmacovigilance System Master File.
- Record self-identified non-conformances and collaborating with the global team to investigate non-conformances while developing and implementing effective Corrective and Preventative Actions (CAPAs).

- Receive and support the Area Safety Head in the responses to safety-related health authority queries.
- Perform reconciliation with other departments (distributors, third parties, vendors, and internal stakeholders).
- Maintain oversight of proper identification of local literature articles for Adverse Event (AE) reporting as required.
- Perform document management and archiving as required.
- Ensure proper documented training on safety reporting responsibilities of LOC personnel and maintenance of awareness of safety reporting in general.
- Perform regulatory monitoring for impact on vigilance activities and responsibilities.
- Collaborate with the global and local teams to notify local health authorities of any safety issues including SSI/ ESI and signals.
- Manage reporting/ submissions of safety reports/ updates/ information (e.g., SAE, SUE, SUSARs, PSUR, RMP) to local health authorities and other client departments as applicable.
- Maintain up-to-date knowledge of local requirements for pharmacovigilance, cosmetovigilance, materiovigilance and nutrivigilance, including reporting requirements (for all applicable product classes in the territory) and collaborating with the global team to implement process changes required for identification of new requirements.
- Ensure pharmacovigilance compliance of local company sponsored programs and research activities as applicable.
- Perform translation for ICSR and PV-related documents, as required.

- Provide technical and strategic input and participate in projects/ workstreams led by the Client's Medical Safety teams or the LOC.

- Develop, update, and implement local procedures to ensure compliance with Client's global procedures and national requirements.
- Ensure current knowledge of all relevant company procedures and training.

- Support local health authority inspections and audits conducted locally, including preparing and responding to queries during the conduct and collaborating with the global team to develop and implement CAPA plans as applicable.

- Management of vigilance contracts and clauses: set-up, revision, internal tracking and periodic reconciliations.

- Ensure implementation of local business continuity plans (e.g., inspection readiness, AE reporting coverage).

- Pharmaceutical industry experience including product vigilance responsibility role.
- A previous experience as Local Safety Officer in Portugal would be a real added value.
- Proven ability to organize workflow activities.
- Computer literate with knowledge of relevant IT safety systems.
- Good verbal and written communication skills.
- Ability to establish and maintain open relationships within the organization and with authorities.
- Demonstrable knowledge of local requirements and global aspects of product safety.
- Mother tongue: Portuguese
- Fluency in the English language is required.

Mutual Respect, Empathy, Innovation and Professional Pride. Do you see yourself within these values?



Founded in 2006 under the mission "To Challenge Complexity" , Closer Consulting is a Data Science and Software Engineering company specialized in Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, Artificial Intelligence, and Software Development.

Through projects across industries ‚Äì Banking, Telecommunications, Health, Retail, Energy, Insurance, and Aviation ‚Äì we transform complexity into clarity, enabling our clients to make the best decisions for their businesses.



We are now looking for a Cloud Infrastruture Engineer to join our team in Portugal.



*For this position, you have to be already in Portugal, and have legal documentation to work in Portugal.







Responsibilities:

- Build and maintain cloud infrastructure for complex enterprise SaaS applications using Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, Pulumi, or similar tools).
- Deploy, scale, and monitor containerized and serverless workloads across AWS, Azure, or GCP.
- Design, implement, and optimize CI/CD pipelines (e.g., GitHub Actions, GitLab CI) for automated testing and deployment.
- Monitor system performance, reliability, and security, and resolve issues efficiently.
- Collaborate with engineering, product, and data teams to deliver and support business-critical features.
- Ensure infrastructure is secure, cost-effective, and highly available.
- Contribute to system architecture and help document processes and best practices.
- Troubleshoot production issues and participate in an on-call rotation as needed.

Requirements:

- Proven experience building and maintaining infrastructure for large-scale, enterprise SaaS applications.
- Proficiency with at least one major cloud provider (AWS, Azure, or GCP) and familiarity with their native services and best practices.
- Hands-on experience with Infrastructure as Code tools such as Terraform or Pulumi.
- Experience with container orchestration (e.g., ECS, EKS, GKE, AKS) and serverless platforms.
- Solid understanding of CI/CD pipelines, automation, and modern DevOps/GitOps practices.
- Familiarity with monitoring, logging, and alerting tools for distributed systems.
- Strong fundamentals in software engineering and systems architecture.
- A fast learner; able to pick up new technologies and adapt to new environments quickly.
- Able to clearly communicate technical concepts and work collaboratively with cross-functional teams in a fully remote, international setting. Fluent English is mandatory.
- Ownership mindset; takes end-to-end responsibility for the quality and reliability of delivered solutions.

Preferred Qualifications:

- Experience working in multi-cloud environments.
- Exposure to data platforms like Databricks or Snowflake.
- Background in high-growth or product-focused SaaS companies.
- Familiarity with AI/ML infrastructure is a plus.

Our Hiring Philosophy:

- We look for engineers who bring new skills and diverse perspectives to the team.
- We value clear, direct communication and strong problem-solving abilities.
- We prioritize learning ability, technical fundamentals, and a sense of ownership over specific credentials.





We believe we are the ones too, by:

- Providing a Multidisciplinary Team ;
- Offering a home office kit to ensure remote performance;
- Supporting your career through a custom training and career plan ;
- Ensuring professional growth and leadership opportunities ;
- Helping you reach happiness at work .



Oh‚Ä¶ and by the way, we also have:

- Several challenging and complex projects ;
- Stimulating teams and leaders ;
- World-class Clients and Partners .



Diversity & Inclusion

At Closer, we value diversity and inclusion . We are committed to fostering an environment where everyone is treated with dignity and respect, regardless of race, gender, beliefs, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other personal characteristics. We embrace unique perspectives and experiences as a fundamental driver of our success.

job title: Conservation Architect (RIBA) - Grade II Listed Home Renovation, Westminster
description:
Project-based contract (all RIBA stages)



Role Overview:



We are seeking a highly experienced, RIBA-chartered Conservation Architect to take full ownership and lead the complete renovation of our Grade II listed private home in Westminster.

This is a project-based contract for the full duration of the project, from concept through to final completion.

The successful candidate will be the primary point of contact for us (the clients) and will be responsible for managing the entire professional team. This is a highly client-facing position requiring exceptional communication skills to liaise directly with us, as well as coordinating all contractors, specialist suppliers, surveyors, and council planning officers.

We require a seasoned professional with ample, demonstrable experience in managing complex heritage projects from start to finish, who can confidently navigate the planning complexities of a Grade II listed building in Westminster.



Key Responsibilities:



- Full Project Ownership: Act as the lead consultant and project manager for all RIBA stages (0-7).
- Client & Team Liaison: Serve as the main point of contact for the clients, providing regular updates. Manage and coordinate all third parties, including contractors, suppliers, structural engineers, and surveyors.
- Design & Conservation: Develop and deliver a complete design scheme that is respectful of the building's historic fabric while meeting modern living standards.
- Planning & Heritage: Prepare and manage all planning applications for Westminster City Council , including Listed Building Consent and the supporting Heritage Statement .
- Technical Delivery: Produce all detailed technical drawings, schedules, and specifications necessary for tender and construction.
- Contract Administration: Oversee the tender process, assist in contractor selection, and administer the building contract, ensuring all work is executed to the highest conservation standard.



Essential Qualifications & Experience:



- RIBA Chartered Architect.
- Accreditation in building conservation (e.g., RIBA Conservation Architect 'CA' or 'SCA', or AABC accredited) is essential.
- A proven portfolio of successful, high-end residential renovations for Grade I or Grade II listed buildings.
- Ample experience and a strong track record of securing Listed Building Consent from Westminster City Council (or similar central London boroughs).
- Demonstrable experience in full project management (all RIBA stages) and contract administration.
- Deep knowledge of traditional building materials, repair techniques, and conservation principles.
- Exceptional project management, communication, and client liaison skills.



Engagement Type:



- This is a project-based contract (fixed-term) for the full duration of the project.
- We are seeking to engage a self-employed individual (sole practitioner) or a specialist architectural practice on a consultant basis.
- This is not a permanent or temporary (PAYE) employment position.



To Apply:



- Please submit your CV and a portfolio (PDF) that specifically highlights your most relevant conservation and listed building projects, detailing your direct role in managing them from start to finish.

description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:



- DECSKILL TALENT : We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.
- DECSKILL BOOST : Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
- DECSKILL CONNECT : Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.



At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.



We are looking for an Product Operations & Program Manager !



Responsabilities:

- Software and Vendor Management - to manage and run our product, we have many third party products and services contracts that we need to purchase and utilize.
- Work closely with Business Owners, to ensure we buy and renew software and services contracts correctly - that we buy the right thing, in the right volume and the right time.
- Provide clear justifications for the purchases, and ensure economies of scale and a roadmap of alternative future options.
- Have a clear and pre-planned timeline to prepare for renewal purchases, and be able to react at short-notice to new and ad-hoc business needs, having a sense of urgency.
- Have a good working relationship with the business, procurement, finance, legal, security and vendors.
- Manage the regular contact meetings between Outsystems and our main partner provider.
- Be sought out for your organizational skills, consistency, thoroughness, objectivity, and drive.
- Early Access Programmes Co-ordination - we regularly run EAPs and Limited Availability programmes to test out new product features.
- Co-ordinate, manage and report on these programmes.
- Although this is a self-service model, you would need to hold colleagues accountable for following the process, advise them on best practices, and ensure accurate and regular reporting of the programmes' progress.
- Build collaborative and trusting partnerships across the product and engineering teams to ensure a successful outcome of your programs.
- Research Program Co-ordination - we have a pool of users registered to test out new product features.
- Coordinate, manage, and report on this program.
- Although a self-service model, you would need to hold colleagues accountable for following the process, advise them on best practices, and ensure accurate and regular reporting of the program's progress.
- Build collaborative and trusting partnerships across the product and UX teams to ensure a successful outcome of your program.
- GDPR compliance record checking - group is compliant with GDPR and needs to take care of the data deletion process.
- Receive the tickets from the DPO and check if any data needs to be deleted or informed to the requester inside our tools.



Requirements :

- 5+ years of a strong, proven track record in program management.
- Exceptional organizational skills; strong written and verbal communication skills.
- Ability to prioritize and plan effectively with exceptional attention to detail; while driving projects to completion according to deadlines and agreed processes.
- Demonstrated ability to report on, analyze, and interpret data for meaningful business metrics.
- High energy, enthusiasm, and passion for the business.
- Proven ability to effectively coordinate and work across functional teams ‚Äì internally and externally, in-person and virtually.
- Demonstrated ability to work well under pressure, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and stay flexible through growth and change.
- Experience with technologies like Atlassian suite of tools, including Confluence and Jira, is a significant asset.
- Fluent English (spoken and written ‚Äì important);



If you‚Äôre interested in this job, please send your CV to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com with reference ‚ÄúCA/ProductOperations&ProgramManager".



Thank You! üòä



Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

About Dialogue Design Agency Inc.

Dialogue Design Agency is a data-centric AI company focused on research, development and services that blend technology with the humanities. We create intuitive conversational experiences between people and AI by designing the personas and dialogue styles of AI assistants (such as Bixby, Siri and Gemini) to make meaningful interactions.



Headquartered in the heart of Korea's AI ecosystem, we collaborate with leading global enterprises, including one of the world's top smartphone manufacturers. Since 2016, we have been pushing the boundaries of conversational AI. With continued growth in Europe, we are looking for skilled contributors to drive the future of AI communication on a global scale.



Position Overview

We are seeking AI Dialogue Analysts and Linguistic Specialists to join our dynamic team. The selected candidates will work as computational linguists to translate, analyze, localize, and proofread data for large-scale AI projects. AI Conversational Linguists will work closely with the project manager to deliver high-quality, linguistically accurate material in the target language to our main client's R&D institute in Poland.



Responsibilities

Translate, proofread, analyze and edit content into target language with proper linguistic tone, flow, and cultural nuance

Improve AI agent responses by analyzing and providing detailed feedback to ensure data is linguistically accurate, culturally relevant, and functionally accurate

Evaluate and refine AI-generated utterances to improve clarity, usability, and overall interaction quality

Create and manage style guides and glossaries to maintain linguistic quality of the target language

Deliver projects on time while upholding the highest standards of quality and precision



Qualifications

- German ‚Äì C2-level language proficiency required.
- Deep cultural understanding of the target language
- Fluent and proficient in spoken and written business English
- Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel)
- Research abilities (writing reports, editing, analyzing)
- Comfortable working with AI tools (LLMs) and capable of guiding their output through well-structured input
- Bachelor's degree or higher in a relevant field
- Excellent organizational and communication skills
- Strong ability to work independently, meet deadlines, and deliver high-quality text
- Work experience in the Translation, Creative Writing, or Language field an advantage



Benefits

- Work with advanced AI technologies, including large language models (LLMs), natural language processing (NLP), and AI assistants
- Contribute to the development of global AI products and real-world applications at scale
- Collaborate with a diverse, international team of highly experienced professionals
- Remote work for an international company



Employment Type

- B2B Contract
- Remote
- Open to candidates currently based anywhere across Central Europe.



Application Process

- Our application process is conducted entirely online:
- Application ‚Üí Pre-screening ‚Üí Assessment ‚Üí Interview ‚Üí Job Offer



Compensation

- All payments are made in euros (‚Ç¨) and are issued monthly.
- Salary range: ‚Ç¨2,000 ‚Äì ‚Ç¨3,000 per month, depending on experience and qualifications.

Role: Performance Engineer (Contract)

Location: Fully Remote (UK)

Day Rate: ¬£400-¬£450 per day (Inside IR35)

Contract Length: 6 months (Possible Extension)



We‚Äôre looking for an experienced Performance Engineer (Contract) to join on an interim basis and drive performance improvements across our applications and infrastructure. You‚Äôll be responsible for identifying bottlenecks, putting the right telemetry in place, and helping our teams deliver a faster, more reliable experience for customers at scale.



Key Must Have Skills:

- .NET (C#),
- DOM performance
- JavaScript
- MS SQL Server, query optimisation, and indexing strategies
- K6, Playwright, AppInsights
- Azure DevOps - CI/CD pipelines and observability tooling



What you‚Äôll be doing

- Front-end performance: Investigate and optimise browser behaviour, including JavaScript execution, rendering, and DOM interactions.
- Backend performance: Analyse .NET applications for efficiency, memory usage, and concurrency, implementing improvements where needed.
- Database tuning: Optimise SQL queries, indexes, and overall database performance.
- Instrumentation & monitoring: Expand and refine telemetry across the stack using tools such as AppInsights, K6, and Playwright.
- Collaboration: Partner with engineers, testers, and product teams to prioritise performance initiatives, share best practices, and influence long-term improvements.
- Load testing: Support the design and execution of realistic load/performance scenarios to uncover weaknesses and recommend fixes.



What we‚Äôre looking for

- Strong background in performance engineering across browser, server, and database layers.
- Hands-on expertise with:
- JavaScript profiling and browser internals.
- .NET (C#), async programming, concurrency, and memory management.
- SQL Server query tuning and indexing.
- Familiarity with modern observability and testing tools (e.g. K6, Playwright, AppInsights, Azure DevOps).
- Good knowledge of CI/CD practices and performance instrumentation.
- Clear communicator, able to turn complex technical findings into actionable recommendations.
- Independent, proactive, and delivery-focused.



Nice to have

- Experience working with Vue.js or other modern front-end frameworks.

About Dreamdo

Dreamdo is a curated platform where independent designers and studios turn their 3D creations into beautiful, made-to-order products. We connect creators with design-conscious audiences who appreciate originality, sustainability, and thoughtful craftsmanship.

We‚Äôre building our first collections and are looking for experienced 3D Product Designers and small studios who would like to collaborate with us and create high-quality objects ready for additive manufacturing.

Please note: We are looking for designers with proven experience in 3D printed products , as our collections require pieces that are ready to go into production.



What we‚Äôre looking for

We‚Äôd love to collaborate with designers and studios who:

- Have hands-on experience creating products that have been physically produced using 3D printing .
- Can conceptualize and model pieces that are both visually appealing and functional.
- Understand how materials, tolerances, and finishing processes influence the final product.
- Enjoy designing objects that enhance people‚Äôs homes and daily lives.



Product categories we‚Äôre focusing on

- Home decor and functional objects: vases, lamps, trays, organizers, candle holders, containers, hooks, small shelves‚Ä¶
- Jewelry and fashion accessories: earrings, rings, pendants, bracelets, brooches, and other wearables.

Responsibilities

Requirements

Nice to have

- Experience with sustainable materials or small-batch production.
- Previous collaborations with design-focused brands or marketplaces.



What we offer

- Inclusion in Dreamdo‚Äôs curated launch collection.
- Royalty-based compensation for every sale.
- Full credit and visibility on our platform and communication channels.
- A friendly, long-term collaboration as our catalog continues to grow.



How to Apply

We‚Äôd love to get to know you and your work. To keep the process organized and give every application proper attention, we kindly ask you to apply by email. Please send your application to: victor@dreamdo.es

If possible, include:

- A short introduction about yourself or your studio
- A link to your portfolio
- Photos or links to 3‚Äì5 products you‚Äôve designed that have been physically 3D printed
- A brief note about the materials and 3D printing technologies used

This helps us understand your experience and see if our styles and processes align.

We‚Äôre excited to discover new designers and hope to collaborate with you.

- Knowledge of DevOps concepts , infrastructure-as-code (Terraform/CloudFormation), and container orchestration (ECS) .

job title: AI Co-Founder / Head of Engineering (100 % remote) (m/f/d)
description:
We are looking to hire ambitious entrepreneurs to start and scale their own startups.

We are serial entrepreneurs, for example Paul M√ºller (founder Adjust, ‚Ç¨1.2B exit) and Petter Made (founder SumUp, ‚Ç¨8B) who are eager to support outlier personalities and serial entrepreneurs to build ‚Ç¨1B+ companies.

Our offer:

- A salary while you build your startup as you will directly be employed by us. Alternatively, you can opt for up to ‚Ç¨500k in funding.
- 1:1 sparring with unicorn founders on a weekly basis
- Community : Access to the top 0.1% of founders, peers and investors
- Team building : Hiring top notch talent supported through our network (over 50,000 professionals)
- Distribution : Support in reaching product-market-fit and building up a sales force / marketing machine
- Funding support for securing a multi-million euro funding round within 12 months (on average, EWOR Fellows raise > ‚Ç¨2M after our Grand Pitch)

One of our fellows set a record for Europe‚Äôs largest pre-seed round by a first-time founder, securing a ‚Ç¨12M pre-seed investment.

- You will own, build, and run your startup in fields such as AI
- You will embark on an extensive personal development journey crafted by unicorn founders and follow a fully customised programme enhancing your goal, time, and energy management
- You will receive support in hiring through our network to over 50,000 professionals and advice as well as best practices from serial entrepreneurs
- You will receive intensive coaching to make your startup ready to raise millions in funding
- You will iterate your product with us until having reached product-market-fit and receive support in building up a sales force or creating a marketing engine respectively

- You are based in Europe or the Americas or open to relocate
- You are willing to take full responsibility for your own startup and scale it to ‚Ç¨100M+ in revenues
- You have excellent communication skills in the English language

Join us and build a ‚Ç¨1B+ company with us!

Seeking: Independent M&A/Strategy Advisor for a Strategic Media Transaction ‚Äì Fanack The Chronicle



Fanack BV (The Hague, Netherlands) operates Fanack The Chronicle ‚Äî a respected bilingual (English‚ÄìArabic) platform providing balanced, in-depth analysis on the Middle East and North Africa.



We are preparing a strategic transaction to bring in new ownership or partnerships that can realize the platform‚Äôs next phase of growth. To that end, we are seeking an experienced independent M&A or strategy advisor with a strong network in media, publishing, or digital-content sectors, ideally with reach in MENA, Europe, or North America, ¬†who can identify and engage strategic buyers or partners



The anticipated transaction size is in the low- to mid-single-digit-million-euro range, and the engagement will be success-based only and time-bound.



We are looking for an advisor who is deal-driven, well-connected, and able to position Fanack‚Äôs value proposition to potential acquirers or partners.





Interested professionals are invited to contact:

Frederik den Haan

Managing Director, Fanack

f.den.haan@fanack.com and info@dake.nl

www.fanack.com
company name: Fanack | Chronicle of the Middle East & North Africa

description:
Application Deadline: 28 November 2025

Department: Professional Football

Location: Remote

- Lead the implementation and growth of the FIFA Talent Coach Programme across Africa, in alignment with the TDS Lead of the regional hub and FIFA HQ.
- Act independently in line with FIFA‚Äôs global strategy, programme standards, and regional priorities.
- Provide ongoing oversight of Member Associations from the application stage through activation and delivery.
- Coordinate programme milestones including discovery visits, onboarding events, milestone events, and national workshops.
- Ensure regional activities are aligned with the overall Talent Coach Programme strategy and contribute to long-term player development success.

- Work closely with TDS Lead of the regional hub and Technical Directors in each Member Association to support national talent development strategies.
- Collaborate with Technical Experts who act as technical leads and supervise groups of Talent Coaches.
- Support Technical Experts in their mentoring function while maintaining overall accountability for programme delivery.
- Ensure strong alignment across stakeholders and manage interfaces between technical, operational, and safeguarding functions.
- Build and sustain trusted relationships with Member Associations, CAF, FIFA regional offices, and FIFA HQ departments.

- Oversee the recruitment, onboarding, and performance management of Talent Coaches in the region coordinated with the TDS Lead of the regional hub and FIFA HQ.
- Monitor coaching activities and ensure continuous professional development through Technical Experts.
- Address escalations and ensure Talent Coaches are aligned with the programme‚Äôs objectives, values, and safeguarding requirements.

- Monitor the quality, progress, and impact of the programme (e.g., adherence to FIFA Academy criteria) across African Member Associations.
- Ensure safeguarding, compliance, and integrity standards are consistently met.
- Provide structured feedback, insights, and recommendations to both the TDS Lead of the regional hub and FIFA HQ.
- Use data, reporting tools, and evidence-based methods to inform decisions and support continuous programme improvement.

- Minimum 5 - 10 years of professional experience in football development, programme management, or technical operations.
- Proven record of managing projects with multiple stakeholders across different countries or organisations.
- Demonstrated ability to coordinate, mediate, and align perspectives in multicultural contexts.
- Experience in collaborating with Member Associations, Confederations, or international sports organisations is desirable.
- Strong background in programme delivery, monitoring, and reporting within football or comparable international development fields.
- On-the-ground experience in African football (e.g., academies, member associations, development programmes) considered an asset. Experience in working with senior leaders in sports, including MA Presidents, General Secretaries and technical staff.
- Master‚Äôs degree or equivalent experience in Sports Management or a related field.
- Minimum of 5 years of experience in elite youth development, academy management, or technical leadership.
- Proven track record in designing and implementing player development programmes at national or club level.
- Technical Expertise with an UEFA Pro or A-License (or equivalent) is strongly preferred.
- In-depth knowledge of talent identification, training methodology, and long-term player development models.
- Recognised manager with advanced management and leadership skills.
- Strong technical football background and expertise in elite youth development.
- Proven ability to operate in multicultural and politically complex African environments.
- Excellent communication, negotiation, and relationship management skills.
- Ability to work independently while aligning with the TDS Lead of the regional hub and FIFA HQ.
- Fluency in oral and written English and French
- Knowledge of Arabic and/or Portuguese is considered a strong asset, given the linguistic diversity across the African continent.
- Proficient in MS Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Visio & Project).
- Proficient in Player Databases.
- Willingness and ability to travel internationally.

job title: Regional Technical Consultant (RTC) for South West Asia - Freelancer
description:
Department: Professional Football

Location: Remote

- Being a FIFA Ambassador on technical development for our Member Associations (MA).
- Manage relationships with assigned Member Associations in South West Asia (number to be determined).
- Regular and constant contact with the Technical Directors of the member associations in South West Asia.
- Being aware of all programmes and services provided by the Global Football Development division (GFD).
- Act as the first point of contact for the MA for all technical development matters. Support the elaboration and follow-up of technical development plans and strategies with the MA.
- Deliver the Amateur Football Environment Analysis, with presentation and follow-up of country reports in South West Asia.
- Assistance with the implementation of the Talent Development Scheme in the member associations of South West Asia and close cooperation with the High-Performance Specialists.
- Induction visits for new Technical Directors.
- Assistance in the setting-up of the structure of the technical department of a federation.
- Assistance in the recruitment of technical leaders (i.e. Technical Directors) in the federations (if requested by the MA).
- Planning, executing, and reporting of online calls and onsite visits referring to the different FIFA programmes.
- Coordinate project management activities, including workshops, site inspections, and meetings with relevant parties.
- Any other duties as advised by the Football Development Operations department and Global Football Development Division.

- Broad knowledge of football development in South West Asia , Familiar with FIFA‚Äôs, and AFC‚Äôs development programmes.
- Experience in the technical development of football.
- Experience as a Technical Director of a federation, career as a player, qualified coach or coach instructor, are a plus.
- Strong team player with excellent social, communication, and diplomatic skills.
- Highly organized with a focus on quality and the ability to work under pressure.
- Ability to prepare, handle and monitor projects.
- Ability to represent the organization confidently in multicultural settings.
- Quick to adapt to new tasks with high flexibility.
- A sports leadership qualification is a plus.
- A coaching qualification is a plus.
- Has a good understanding of the global football landscape of MAs, confederations, clubs, leagues, and other stakeholders, including cultural differences.
- Has experience and understanding how football/sports organisations are run and organised and more specifically on the technical development side.
- Has experience in delivering and organising consultancy activities - preferably in a sports environment.
- Fluency in oral and written in Arabic and English is a must, any other languages (e.g French) are a plus.
- Proficient in MS Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook)
- Willingness to travel.

Co-Founding Back-End Engineer



Join the Revolution of On-Demand Services with Gler

(Backed by Fyaora, the backbone of next-gen platforms)

Location: Remote / UK Preferred

Compensation: Equity up to 1,000,000 shares (co-founder level, no salary at initial stage)

Start Date: ASAP

Tech Stack Proficiency Needed: Java, Springboot & AWS



About Gler

We‚Äôre building Gler, an on-demand platform reimagining how customers connect with trusted cleaners. From hourly bookings to quote-based services, Gler brings automation, real-time availability, and a seamless experience to the home services market.



This is your opportunity to join the genesis team. We‚Äôre lean, agile, and ambitious. Early team members will directly shape our product architecture, culture, and long-term success.

Gler is powered by Fyaora, a scalable infrastructure engine fueling our present and future growth.



The Role

We‚Äôre looking for a Back-End Engineer with strong expertise in designing secure, scalable systems and an entrepreneurial drive to help build a company from the ground up.

As a founding engineer, you‚Äôll architect core server-side logic, APIs, and integrations while ensuring performance, reliability, and security across our platform. You‚Äôll also help shape the technical roadmap as we scale post-launch.

This isn‚Äôt just about coding, it‚Äôs about building the backbone of a company.



What You‚Äôll Do

- Design and build back-end infrastructure that is scalable, secure, and reliable
- Develop and maintain APIs (RESTful/GraphQL) to connect mobile and web clients
- Implement business logic and complex workflows using Java + Spring Boot
- Integrate third-party services like Stripe.js for payment processing
- Manage and optimize databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, DynamoDB)
- Leverage AWS services (EC2, S3, RDS, Lambda, etc.) to ensure efficiency and scalability
- Implement best practices for security, compliance (GDPR, CCPA), and performance optimization
- Collaborate with front-end, mobile, and product teams to deliver seamless end-to-end experiences
- Define and maintain CI/CD pipelines for efficient deployments
- Write tests, debug issues, and document system architecture



What You Bring

- 4+ years of experience in back-end development
- Strong proficiency in Java & Spring Boot for microservices and server logic
- Experience integrating Stripe.js or other payment solutions
- Expertise in API design (RESTful/GraphQL) with secure authentication (OAuth2, JWT)
- Hands-on experience with databases (SQL + NoSQL) and optimization
- Solid understanding of AWS cloud services and scalable architectures
- Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines, Git, and containerization (Docker/Kubernetes a plus)
- Strong problem-solving, communication, and ownership mindset
- Entrepreneurial spirit, comfortable building in ambiguity, focused on execution and growth



Why Join Gler

- Up to 1,000,000 shares in equity-based compensation
- Strategic co-founder role with significant influence over tech direction
- Be part of the genesis team, before we scale 10x post-launch
- Remote-first, ownership-driven culture
- No red tape, just impact, speed, and collaboration



Who This Role is For

- Back-end engineers who want more than a job, they want ownership
- Builders excited to shape something transformative from scratch
- Entrepreneurs who have dreamed of starting a company but needed the right team



Apply Now

We‚Äôre not hiring employees (yet), we‚Äôre building a founding team. If you‚Äôre ready to take the leap and help define the future of on-demand services, we want to hear from you.



Be part of something extraordinary. Be part of Gler.

Department: Technology

Location: Malta

- Platform Development and Maintenance: Enhance and maintain the platform, focusing on Servlets, JSP, Filters, and their lifecycles, as well as integrations.
- DevOps & CI/CD Mindset: Adopt a DevOps philosophy by promoting small, frequent releases and continuous improvement through feedback loops. Collaborate with the Java Tech Lead to establish and maintain CI/CD pipelines and automation.
- Component-Based Design: Build reusable, modular components and libraries to support efficient development and maintainability across different brands.
- Third-Level Support: Investigate and resolve production incidents, provide hotfixes, and ensure timely solutions for customer issues.
- Collaboration: Work closely with the Java Tech Lead, Product Owner, and other devs to ensure new features or platform adaptations meet functional and technical requirements.
- Testing & Quality: Focus on quality through automated testing, ensuring reliable, high-performance code. Implement unit, integration, and end-to-end testing.
- Feedback Loops: Regularly gather and incorporate feedback from stakeholders, end-users, and internal teams to iteratively improve the product.
- API Integration: Work with service providers to build or adapt APIs and integrate third-party services into the PAM.
- Documentation: Create clear, concise technical documentation to ensure maintainability and facilitate onboarding for new team members.
- OnCall rotation availability.

- 4 years in Java with solid understanding of OOP , design patterns , and multithreading .
- Hands-on experience building scalable web applications using Spring and Struts frameworks.
- Skilled in RESTful API design and integration, ensuring secure and efficient communication between systems.
- Proficient in SQL and MySQL , including query optimization and database performance tuning.
- Familiar with Servlets , JSP , and Filters for server-side application management.
- Experienced with Maven/Gradle and CI/CD pipelines for streamlined build and deployment processes.
- Advanced use of Git for version control, branching, and collaborative workflows.
- Strong focus on performance optimization , testing , debugging , and secure coding practices .

We have an immediate contract vacancy for an Operations Engineer to work with our prestigious renewable energy client.

The role has been deemed outside IR35 & is expected to last at least 6 months

The core working hours/days per week: 37.5 hours/5 days



Our client is the UK‚Äôs leading developer of low-carbon, city-heat-networks. Their mission is to decarbonise heat in cities and towns across the UK, accelerating the transition to net zero.

Their heat networks provide the lowest cost, simplest and fastest route to decarbonising heat at scale and a long-term foundation for healthier, greener cities.

Our client has rapidly grown from a start-up to having over ¬£600m of heat networks in development, with ambitions to deploy ¬£1bn within the next eight years into building new networks.

Their team are leaders in the heat network industry‚Äîhaving delivered and operated more than 100 district heating projects over the past 15 years.

Due to this rapid expansion they are looking for an engaging, communicative team member who is able to work successfully as part of a fast-paced team and business. You will have experience working in challenging environments under pressure and will be able to quickly pick up new concepts to produce great outcomes for the business.

You should be inspired by working with a team who are delivering a new and exciting heat network operations to the market and feel comfortable working with external stakeholders.

You should be an enthusiastic and dedicated team member, calm under pressure when given new challenges, quick at developing relationships and willing to get involved in any area to

keep the programme moving.

Responsibilities:-

‚Ä¢ Work closely with the Operations Director to ensure that assets are technically and contractually ready for commercial operations

‚Ä¢ Responsible for co-ordination of handover of projects from construction into operations

‚Ä¢ Responsible for co-ordination and managing day 1 readiness plan of the projects ensuring that Operations & Maintenance (O&M) contractors are onboarded to the projects

‚Ä¢ Ensure that all technical documents and as- built drawings are reviewed, finalised and filed in accordance with our client‚Äôs document management system

‚Ä¢ Support O&M procurement activities for operations team providing inputs to tendering process and operational schedules for contracts

‚Ä¢ Support to provide operational cost estimations to the project commercial models by owning and maintaining operational costs estimation tools

What you‚Äôll need

‚Ä¢ Minimum two years‚Äô experience in the energy sector, ideally in heat

‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs degree qualified, with a minimum 2:1

‚Ä¢ High motivation to contribute to our client‚Äôs ambitions of low carbon heat networks

‚Ä¢ Brilliant and engaging communicator in all forms

‚Ä¢ Clear, structured and organised thinker

‚Ä¢ Hardworking and effective

‚Ä¢ Excellent team player ‚Äì able to work cross-functionally and bring people together

‚Ä¢ Strong written English skills



Our client‚Äôs team is comprised of head office remote and on-site roles, with our team members based across the UK. For this role, although set as home working, there will be occasional travel as required, predominantly to our client‚Äôs West Yorkshire projects, but also to meet with customers, stakeholders and colleagues.

All applicants must be eligible to legally work in the UK.



For more information on this excellent temporary opportunity with our market leading client please contact the recruitment team or apply online & we will get back to you

job title: Freelance Influencer Marketing Manager (m/f/x) - 20-25hrs/week (freelance & remote position)
description:

We‚Äôve made waves in the German market and built a loyal following ‚Äì now we‚Äôre doubling down to accelerate growth, increase brand share, and deepen our connection with consumers through high-performance influencer campaigns.

Join GradeGuru as a Trainer

About GradeGuru

GradeGuru is a Netherlands-based platform that helps university students prepare for their exams through live and recorded trainings. We make studying smarter and more interactive by connecting students who understand the material deeply with others who want to learn it better. Our Trainers are current university students who enjoy teaching, want to grow their skills, and earn meaningful income alongside their studies.



What the Role Involves

As a Trainer, you host live online exam preparation sessions for fellow students. You explain key concepts, go through examples, and help them feel more confident before their exams. You prepare your sessions independently, teach online through Zoom, and have full flexibility to plan around your own study schedule.

Most of our Trainers started as students who once attended a GradeGuru session themselves. They know exactly what kind of support makes the difference when preparing for exams.



What You‚Äôll Do

- Host live online trainings on Zoom
- Explain the course material in a clear and engaging way
- Help students connect ideas and understand what matters most for their exams
- Create a positive and motivating learning atmosphere
- Collaborate with the GradeGuru team to deliver high-quality sessions



Who We‚Äôre Looking For

We‚Äôre looking for confident, reliable, and communicative students who:

- Understand their university course material well
- Enjoy helping others learn and succeed
- Are comfortable teaching and speaking in English
- Can manage their time responsibly and professionally
- Are based in the Netherlands or available during CET hours



What You‚Äôll Gain

- ‚Ç¨30 per teaching hour
- Flexible work that fits around your studies
- A professional yet friendly environment
- Real teaching and communication experience
- A meaningful way to use your knowledge while earning extra income
- A strong addition to your CV that shows initiative and leadership



Why It‚Äôs Worth It

Working as a Trainer helps you grow as a communicator, strengthen your understanding of your subject, and build confidence in speaking and leading. You‚Äôll gain skills that stay with you long after graduation, all while making a real impact on other students‚Äô success. You‚Äôll be part of a motivated, international team that values professionalism, clarity, and collaboration.

Functieomschrijving

Wil jij een actieve bijdrage leveren aan de energietransitie √©n goed verdienen? Voor een snelgroeiende organisatie in de duurzame energiesector zoeken wij een commercieel ingestelde adviseur. Je bezoekt particuliere klanten op afspraak (warme leads) en adviseert hen over thuisbatterijen ‚Äì een product met een groeiende vraag.





Wat ga je doen?

- Bezoeken van klanten op afspraak (leads worden voor je ingepland)
- Adviseren over thuisbatterijen op basis van hun persoonlijke woonsituatie en verbruik
- Opstellen en opvolgen van offertes
- Contact onderhouden met het binnendienstteam over klantafspraken en orders





Wat bieden wij?

- Volle agenda met warme afspraken (geen koude acquisitie)
- Uitstekend verdienmodel, gebaseerd op je prestaties (per verkoop)
- Flexibele werktijden: jij bepaalt je eigen beschikbaarheid
- Ondersteuning vanuit een professioneel team en duidelijke processen
- Focus op √©√©n productcategorie met veel marktvraag





Wat vragen wij?

For our client, we are looking for Offshore / Marine/Client Representative Offshore (m/f/d)



Start: January 2026

Duration: 5 months plus

Workload: 12-Hour Shift; 2 Weeks on/off on a rotational basis

Location: Offshore Vessel: TBC; Crew Change Location/Base Port: Eemshaven, the Netherlands (or other North European port)

Language: english



PPE to be provided by the supplier

Nordsee Cluster A (NSC-A)



Description

The Client Representative Offshore shall ensure that all Termination & Testing (T&T) activities are completed safely, on time, and in full compliance with the approved procedures, RAMS, and project quality standards. The role involves technical witnessing, coordination, and assurance of all HV and FO termination and testing operations, ensuring that works are executed according to contractual and manufacturer requirements.



‚Ä¢ Review and understand the Project‚Äôs HSE Plan, including the Emergency Response Plan, and ensure the Contractor adheres to all HSE requirements.

‚Ä¢ Review health, safety, and technical documentation prior to execution and stay updated on revisions to procedures, RAMS, and ITPs.

‚Ä¢ Prepare and issue Daily Progress Reports (DPRs) capturing progress of terminations and testing, equipment condition, deviations, weather downtime, and other relevant operational notes, ensuring required parties sign off.

‚Ä¢ Confirm that all completed terminations and testing activities meet Employer Requirements, project specifications, and quality control measures.

‚Ä¢ Oversee and verify installation of permanent hang-offs, cable containment and cleats.

‚Ä¢ Witness and verify the execution of HV and FO terminations, including cable preparation, assembly, in accordance with the approved supplier manuals (e.g. Pfisterer HV)

‚Ä¢ Witness and monitor all testing stages, including HV sheath testing, HV SAT, and FO OTDR testing, ensuring proper execution in accordance with task plas/procedures/etc, calibrated instruments, and compliance with acceptance criteria.

‚Ä¢ Ensure the Contractor maintains accurate test records, calibration certificates, and as-built documentation; review and comment on deliverables as required.

‚Ä¢ Attend and actively participate in daily coordination meetings, toolbox talks, and project progress calls; raise and escalate issues to Offshore Site Management where necessary.

‚Ä¢ Record and monitor Safety Observation Cards (SOCs) during daily meetings, and report key safety findings or near misses to the Offshore Site Management and HSE Team.

‚Ä¢ Perform site inspections and walkdowns, verifying that environmental and safety controls are implemented and maintained in all work areas.

‚Ä¢ Act on behalf of the Employer‚Äôs Quality Manager when required to witness inspection points, review NCRs, and confirm completion of corrective actions.

‚Ä¢ Support the management of Non-Conformance Reports (NCRs), Management of Change (MoC) processes, and Project Progress Reviews by providing timely and factual input from site observations.

‚Ä¢ In the event of any incident or unplanned event, gather detailed notes, photographs, and timelines to support investigations (the Contractor typically leads such investigations).

‚Ä¢ Participate in pre- and post-campaign meetings to review lessons learned and identify potential improvements for future T&T campaigns.

‚Ä¢ Maintain a high level of communication with onshore support teams, providing updates on progress, risks, and any required clarifications from the Employer‚Äôs engineering or quality teams.

‚Ä¢ During all defined key activities, and as often as practicable, be present as a witness during all critical T&T operations.



CERTIFICATIONS:

‚Ä¢ GWO Training:

o Sea Survival,

o Working at heights,

o First Aid,

o Fire Awareness,

o Manual Handling.

HUET with CA-EBS (Helictoper Underwater Escape Training, with Compressed Air - Emergency Breathing System) training

‚Ä¢ Current valid medical certificate and exams for offshore work according to legal requirements.

‚Ä¢ IT proficient (Microsoft Word, Excel and Internet) Optional: GIS (QGIS /ARC GIS) and drafting software (DWGtrueview, AutoCAD or similar)

‚Ä¢ Experience using inspection/auditing software in a construction environment (desirable).





Requirements:



The Client Representative offshore shall have

‚Ä¢ a minimum of 5-years‚Äô experience of similar services in offshore renewable industry;

‚Ä¢ working knowledge of offshore construction contracts with a good understanding of the contractual implications of breakdowns, delays, weather downtime etc.

‚Ä¢ profound understanding of offshore operations, in particular Inter Array Cable Termination & Testing operations:

o Inter Array Cable stripping, routing & cleating

o Permanent Hang-Off Installation

o Pre-Termination Testing (HV and FO)

o HV Pfisterer Terminations

o FO Splicing

o FO Site Acceptance Testing (OTDR)

o HV Site Acceptance Testing (Earth resistance, DC Sheath, Voltage Withstand [VLF], Partial Discharge, etc)

‚Ä¢ the ability to read and understand technical documents and observe (offshore) operations and ensure these are carried out according to the contractual requirements;

‚Ä¢ the ability to perform quality assurance and verification activities on a daily basis, ensuring strict compliance with Employer Requirements, contractor procedures, and manufacturer‚Äôs installation instructions;

‚Ä¢ the ability to provide clear and technically justified recommendations related to Management of Change (MoC), Non-Conformance Reports (NCRs), and Project Progress, supporting timely and accurate reporting to the Project Management;

‚Ä¢ proficiency in identifying, raising, and following up on deviations, punch points, and inspection findings, ensuring appropriate corrective measures are implemented;

‚Ä¢ experience coordinating and witnessing electrical and optical testing, including verification of test configurations, instrumentation calibration, and acceptance criteria;

‚Ä¢ knowledge about industry standards and regulations, including but limited to International Maritime Organization (IMO) & IMCA guidelines;

‚Ä¢ excellent communication skills, able to communicate effectively with others (shall be fluent in spoken and written English)
