Service Description

We are requiring the Services of a Freelancer¬†to be¬†part of the Digital Operations Department, as the Metadata & Personalisation Architecture Specialist to oversee the design and governance of tagging ontologies, taxonomies, and metadata frameworks that drive personalisation and discoverability across Olympic digital platforms.

This role is central to ensuring that content is structured and enriched to power AI-driven recommendations, multilingual search, and personalised user journeys. Working closely with the Data & Analytics Department , the Specialist will align metadata models with audience insights and behavioural data to improve recommendation accuracy and content relevance.

By connecting content architecture with analytics and data pipelines, the Specialist will help deliver tailored, data-informed storytelling experiences to global sports fans, supporting the mission of Olympics.com to inspire, engage, and connect audiences worldwide.



Duties & Responsibilities

Lead & Govern Metadata Frameworks

- Design,      develop, and maintain metadata schemas, taxonomies, and semantic models to      support personalisation and AI-driven content discovery.
- Ensure      alignment and consistency of tagging frameworks across platforms, creating      scalable and interoperable ontology structures.
- Define      and enforce governance models to maintain metadata integrity and ensure      sustainable personalisation workflows.

Optimise for AI & Personalisation

- Design      tagging workflows that capture meaningful data signals for recommendation      engines and machine learning models.
- Conduct      metadata quality audits to maintain accuracy, reliability, and alignment      with organisational objectives.
- Establish      clear standards for metadata enrichment, retrieval, and integration across      content and data systems.

Drive Personalisation & Distribution

- Collaborate      with data science and analytics teams to refine tagging strategies and      enhance AI-driven recommendations.
- Use      analytics insights to measure tagging performance and continuously improve      personalisation logic.
- Ensure      metadata frameworks support adaptive, multi-platform delivery (web,      mobile, and OTT), optimising for user behaviour and engagement.

Collaborate for Personalisation Excellence

- Partner      with Data & Analytics, Editorial, Product, and (Digital¬†Engagement and Marketing)¬†DEM teams to align      metadata with audience segmentation, campaign targeting, and      personalisation goals.
- Act as      the subject-matter expert and provide guidance, documentation, and      training on tagging standards and ontology implementation.

Innovate with AI & Emerging Technologies

- Stay      informed on advancements in metadata automation, semantic search, and      AI-based personalisation.
- Evaluate      and integrate tools leveraging AI/ML, NLP, and automated tagging for      scalability and efficiency.
- Develop      frameworks that support multilingual personalisation, SEO,      and semantic consistency across languages and platforms.

Skills, Requirements & Qualifications

- Degree      in Engineering, Data Science, Information Science, or a related field.
- Minimum of 3-5 years¬†in taxonomy design, metadata management, and ontology      governance, ideally within large-scale or digital ecosystems.
- Experience      designing metadata structures for AI-based personalisation, recommendation      engines, or ML pipelines.
- Strong      understanding of SEO, natural language processing (NLP), and semantic      technologies.
- Analytical mindset, able to translate data insights into scalable      tagging frameworks.
- Experience      managing multilingual metadata and large, content-rich environments.
- Familiarity      with Olympic sports content or large event ecosystems is a strong      advantage.
- Excellent      communication, collaboration, and stakeholder management skills in a      multicultural environment.
- Passion      for digital storytelling, innovation, and audience personalisation.

job title: Lead Process Engineer Water Treatment / Clean Water
description:
Lead Process Engineer - Contract - Water / Utility sector

You will join our integrated, national team, working on high-impact projects that span the entire water cycle across the UK & Ireland. We're looking for engineers who are ready to transition from foundational roles to project leadership and technical specialisation.

- The Cleanwater Journey: Help secure long-term water supply through strategic resource options , design state-of-the-art treatment facilities, and pioneer source-to-tap solutions for emerging contaminants like PFAS.
- The Wastewater Journey: Focus on achieving ambitious environmental goals, designing advanced treatment for nutrient removal, optimising asset performance, and implementing schemes that champion resource recovery (energy, heat, and materials).

.

Your Day-to-Day Impact

You will be involved in the full project lifecycle, operating as a key technical contributor:

- Technical Excellence: Lead process design development, perform hydraulic analysis, develop mass balance models, and prepare technical reports and specifications.
- Client Collaboration: Work directly with UK water utility clients, helping to shape business plans and translate strategic needs into viable engineering solutions.
- Global Networking: Engage with our "one team" global community, sharing knowledge and applying international best practices to local challenges.

Degree in Chemical Engineer and have more than 15 years in the Utilities / Water sector only delivering AMP frameworks

Remote (UK only/Reading/Exeter)

12-month fixed term contract



What it's like to work at Landmark:



At Landmark, you'll find a friendly, dynamic, and supportive team that values bold ideas, big dreams, and active curiosity. We foster a culture of innovation, encouraging everyone to contribute to the development and direction of our products and services, while continuously seeking new and efficient ways to work.



Collaboration and sociability are at the heart of what we do, and we take pride in coming together to achieve great things.



We offer a range of benefits to support your well-being and career growth, including:



- Competitive Salary
- Generous Holiday Allowance : 25 days' holiday plus bank holidays, with the option of adding up to 5 additional unpaid leave days per year
- Annual Lifestyle Allowance : ¬£300 to spend on an activity of your choice
- Pension Scheme : Matched up to 6% for the first 3 years, and up to 10% thereafter
- Private Health Insurance : Provided by Vitality
- Group Income Protection Scheme
- Charitable Fundraising : Matched funding for your efforts
- Cycle to Work and Gym Flex Schemes
- Internal Coaching and Mentoring : Available throughout your time with us
- Training and Career Progression : A strong focus on your development
- Family-Friendly Policies
- Free Parking



Join us at Landmark and be part of a team that supports your ambitions and growth, both personally and professionally.



The Opportunity



Join one of the UK Government‚Äôs most ambitious digital transformation programmes, helping to centralise Local Authority Land Charge registers into a single Land Registry system.



We‚Äôre looking for a Data Analyst to support the transformation of complex datasets from multiple Local Authorities into a standardised schema. You‚Äôll work across both digital and manual data sources, ensuring accuracy, consistency, and quality throughout the process.



Key Responsibilities:



- Analyse and clean large datasets from varied sources
- Identify and fix data issues, including geometry and formatting errors
- Quality control data from manual and third-party sources
- Compare pre- and post-transformation outcomes to ensure accuracy
- Document transformation rules and maintain audit trails
- Collaborate with engineers to define technical requirements
- Contribute to process and tool improvements



About You



You‚Äôre a confident communicator with a strong analytical mindset and a passion for working with complex datasets. You bring a mix of technical expertise and stakeholder engagement skills, and you thrive in a collaborative environment.



We‚Äôre looking for someone with:



- Excellent communication skills across all stakeholder levels
- Advanced proficiency in Excel and SQL
- Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities
- Experience working with spatial data and GIS tools (e.g. QGIS, ArcGIS)
- Knowledge of UK "human" geography i.e. planning (TPO, Plan Apps, Listed buildings) and constraints (Article 4, SSSI, CAs)
- Proven ability to manage, analyse and clean large, multi-source datasets
- Understanding of optimal methods for data capture and transformation
- Knowledge of Local Authority processes is desirable



About Us



Landmark Information Group holds a wide portfolio of market leading Prop-Tech (property technology) businesses that span an incredible range of markets and technology platforms across the sector. We are at the forefront of innovation and thought leadership in the property industry, being a supplier of national property-related data.



We deliver award-winning solutions to estate agency, conveyancing, surveying, lender valuations, land asset management, environmental consultancy, and Government markets. This is a chance to join the business as we make major steps forward in leveraging the latest cloud and large-scale technologies to start bringing together the entire market to a unified platform.



We are proud to be an equal opportunities employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

We are looking for a Paid Social Specialist to join our Marketing team focused on Apps. You will be responsible for planning, executing, and optimizing campaigns across Meta, TikTok, and other social platforms to drive user acquisition and retention for our app portfolio. This is a hands-on performance marketing role that requires strong analytical skills, creativity, and curiosity to test, learn, and scale. You'll collaborate closely with SEM, Programmatic, Creative, Data, and Product teams to ensure we hit growth and profitability goals.

What You'll Do

- Plan, launch, and optimize Paid Social campaigns across Meta, TikTok, and emerging networks.
- Manage daily campaign operations, ensuring spend efficiency and alignment with CAC, ROAS, and LTV targets.

- Conduct structured A/B tests on creatives, audiences, and bidding strategies to drive incremental performance.
- Analyze campaign data to extract insights and build optimization hypotheses.
- Collaborate with Data & Martech to refine attribution models and reporting accuracy.
- Monitor market trends, platform innovations, and algorithm updates to identify new opportunities.
- Support budget pacing, forecasting, and reporting across multiple apps and geographies.

- 5 years of hands-on experience managing Paid Social campaigns (Meta Ads Manager and TikTok Ads required and other platforms a plus).
- Proven track record of managing mid-to-large budgets (‚Ç¨200k-1M+/month) and achieving measurable growth results.
- Strong analytical mindset, comfortable with Excel/Sheets and analytics tools (Appsflyer, RevenueCat, Looker, etc.).
- Understanding of mobile app marketing, especially metrics like CPI, ROAS, LTV, retention, and payback period.
- Experience working with creative testing frameworks and performance-driven storytelling.
- Proactive, detail-oriented, and eager to experiment and learn in

Growth and career development

- At Leadtech, we prioritize your growth. Enjoy a flexible career path with personalized internal training and an annual budget for external learning opportunities.

Work-Life balance

- Benefit from a flexible schedule with flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. start, 3:30 - 6 p.m. end) and the option of working full remote or from our Barcelona office. Enjoy free Friday afternoons with a 7-hour workday, plus a 35-hour workweek in July and August so you can savor summer!

Comprehensive benefits

- Competitive salary, full-time permanent contract, and top-tier private health insurance (including dental and psychological services).
- 25 days of vacation plus your birthday off, with flexible vacation options‚Äîno blackout days!

Unique Perks

- If you wish to come, in our office in Barcelona you'll find it complete with free coffee, fresh fruit, snacks, a game room, and a rooftop terrace with stunning Mediterranean views.
- Additional benefits include ticket restaurant and nursery vouchers, paid directly from your gross salary.

Join us in an environment where you're free to innovate, learn, and grow alongside passionate professionals. At Leadtech, you'll tackle exciting challenges and be part of a vibrant team dedicated to delivering exceptional user experiences

Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

The personal data you provide will be used to manage your candidacy for the corporate selection processes that fit your profile. If you wish, you can exercise your rights of access, rectification or cancellation by sending a letter to Avenida Litoral, 12-14, 5ta planta, Barcelona 08005, or emailing us at protecciondedatos@LeadTech.com, including a document that validates your identity.

Company Description



Limohawk.com is the UK‚Äôs first chauffeur booking marketplace, revolutionizing luxury ground transport by directly connecting customers with trusted operators without intermediaries or hidden fees. Customers can book rides such as airport transfers, hourly hires, or point-to-point trips through a seamless process that includes real-time comparisons and instant confirmations. Chauffeurs and operators benefit from fair partnerships, low commission fees, and tools to manage their fleets while setting their own prices. With UK-wide coverage, Limohawk.com is gearing up to launch, bringing a smarter, more transparent travel experience for all stakeholders. Be a part of this innovative transformation in premium travel services.

description:

Simple Life is the #1 AI-powered health coaching app for adults who want to lose weight and enjoy a healthier lifestyle‚Äîwithout the stress or extremes. Our mission is to empower people to feel their best every day. By challenging traditional, restrictive approaches, Simple offers a more sustainable method grounded in ease, personalization, and real-life support.

Simple has had over 17 million downloads and more than 300,000 5-star reviews, having helped millions lose weight successfully and sustainably. Simple has earned recognition as Best Virtual Coach and one of the Top 100 AI companies ‚Äî all thanks to a dedicated global team driving real impact.

With SIMPLE as a partner in their pocket, users feel cared for and empowered to embrace ‚Äî and stick to ‚Äî new healthy habits. To learn more, visit simple.life.

We are seeking a high-energy, results-driven Influencer Marketing Assistant

The Influencer Marketing Assistant supports the day-to-day execution of influencer campaigns ‚Äî from initial outreach and negotiation to managing scouts and ensuring smooth communication across all stages of collaboration. This role requires strong organizational abilities, solid communication and negotiation skills, and a deep understanding of social media trends and creator dynamics.

- Initial Outreach & Negotiation: Initiate contact with influencers, introduce collaboration opportunities, and handle early-stage negotiations around deliverables, pricing, and timelines while maintaining professionalism and empathy.
- Scout Management: Coordinate and supervise scouts who identify potential influencers for upcoming campaigns. Review submissions, give feedback, and ensure proposed creators meet campaign quality standards.
- Influencer Screening: Evaluate influencer profiles for content relevance, audience authenticity, engagement rates, and platform fit.
- Reporting & Feedback: Summarize campaign performance, influencer response rates, and outreach metrics for the influencer marketing manager.

- 2+ years of experience in influencer marketing, including hands-on outreach, negotiations, and campaign launches in the US & UK markets.
- Ability to manage several influencer activations at once.
- Strong negotiation skills to secure high-value partnerships.
- A data-friendly mindset, able to review metrics, set sensible budgets, and spot any red flags in creator profiles.
- Positive energy and a can-do attitude, comfortable working in a fast-paced, growing environment with a solid workload.
- Great communication and relationship-building skills.
- Understanding of social media algorithms and key influencer marketing metrics.
- Experience in health & wellness products and strong familiarity with the US and UK influencer space is a bonus.

- Open-minded teams, a welcoming and inclusive company culture, plus the opportunity to make a real difference with a game-changing health tech product;
- A competitive salary based on your unique expertise, skillset, and impact on the product;
- Flexible hours. We focus on your results, not how long you spend at your desk.

Join us at Simple and make a real impact in the world of health and wellness!

- Love catching what others miss?

- Get a thrill from a clean regression report?
- Want to level up your QA career inside one of the fastest-growing creator-tech platforms?

- Solid grasp of SDLC and QA methodologies.
- Hands-on experience with bug tracking tools (e.g., Jira).
- Analytical, detail-oriented, and organized with great time management.
- Communicative, curious, and motivated to support others.

- Have experience testing native mobile apps on physical devices.
- Understand CI / CD pipelines and version control.
- Know a thing or two about automation testing (Webdriver.io, JS).
- Are familiar with API testing and backend validation.
- Can talk QA fluently - from smoke tests to regression suites.

- The Passion.io Experience : What We Do & How We Work

- Remote-First : Work from anywhere in the world.
- Creative Autonomy :

- Fast Learning Curve : Get real exposure to the creator-tech industry.
- Career Impact :

- Collaborative Culture : We celebrate curiosity, experimentation, and clear communication.
- Your Hiring Journey : Simple, Fast & Human

job title: Senior Camera Systems Engineer - C++ Imaging Software
description:
Our client is building the imaging systems behind future AR/VR and smart-glasses products. We're hiring a senior engineer to develop the C++ simulation and imaging tools used to explore new camera architectures.



What you'll do

- Build C++ imaging and simulation software used by camera/optics teams.
- Translate prototype MATLAB/Python models into production-quality C++.
- Work with optics, image quality and graphics teams on the full pipeline.



Must Have Skills

- Proven camera development experience with lenses, sensors or ISP/pipelines.
- Strong image design and image quality background.
- 8+ years building complex C++ software, i deally in imaging/simulation.



Nice to have

- Experience taking prototypes into C++.
- Understanding of lens modelling, calibration or camera metrology.



The Offer

- Annual Salary up to ¬£125,000 doe and location
- 12-month PAYE contract, inside IR35.
- Fully remote in the UK - to be considered must hold UK work authorisation (no sponsorship, and cannot work abroad)



Next Steps...

Apply Now with your CV or LinkedIn profile today to Som in Principle for immediate consideration and more information.

Progetti principali

1. Automated Product Recipe Generation Sviluppo di una soluzione che, dato un modello-colore e i suoi componenti personalizzabili, generi automaticamente una ricetta di prodotto custom che replichi fedelmente l'originale. We are seeking an experienced Solution Architect with a strong background in data-centric solutions.



Job details:

- 6-month initial contract with a high potential for extension.
- Fully remote opportunity within the UK, with any ad-hoc travel expenses covered.
- Day Rate: ¬£400 - ¬£450 per day (Inside IR35)
- Essential Requirement: Candidates must hold active SC Clearance.



About the Role:

Join a major delivery partner on a transformative project for a large-scale, public-sector organisation. You will be responsible for designing robust, secure, and value-for-money data solutions that align with key digital principles and enterprise architecture.

You will report into a Lead Technical Architect, working within a multi-disciplinary agile team to drive the technical vision from discovery through to delivery.



Key Responsibilities:

- Architecture Design: Lead, deliver, and support the technical architecture design for a key product. Create solution options, recommendations, and high-quality documentation for governance.
- Compliance & Standards: Ensure all product designs adhere to the organisation's Digital Blueprint, Enterprise Architecture, and Product Roadmaps. Advocate for solutions that reduce complexity and technical debt.
- Roadmap Development: Be accountable for product architecture and contribute to the product roadmap, identifying and implementing effective architecture patterns.
- Community & Capability: Share best practices, mentor other architects, and contribute to the development of an inclusive architecture practice.
- Data Expertise: Design and implement solutions involving data integration from disparate sources (e.g., ERP, CRM, IoT), real-time data pipelines, and batch processing.
- Analytics & BI: Apply your knowledge of data warehousing, data lakes, and business intelligence technologies to create effective analytics solutions.



Essential Criteria:

- Proven experience designing and representing end-to-end architecture solutions in an agile environment.
- Strong background in ensuring architectural compliance with established blueprints and standards.
- Hands-on experience with data integration, real-time/batch data pipelines, and analytics/BI technologies.
- A collaborative mindset, with experience working closely with engineers and other stakeholders to deliver user-focused solutions.
- Excellent documentation skills, with the ability to produce high-level solution architecture artefacts for governance.



How to Apply:

If you are a SC Cleared Solution Architect with the required experience and are available for a new contract, please apply now by submitting your CV.



We are looking to move quickly, so please do not hesitate to get in touch.



(Note: Due to the urgent nature of this role and the clearance requirement, we can only consider applicants who hold active SC Clearance.)

Camera Systems Engineer

12 months contract - possible extension

Fully Remote



The team builds the full camera simulation pipeline used across flagship products ‚Äî from early concept to final architecture decisions.

If you enjoy solving first-principles optical challenges, building simulations, and working on cutting-edge imaging tech‚Ä¶ this role is for you.



Role Overview

You will join the Camera Architecture & Simulation team , responsible for:

- Developing & validating optical models for end-to-end imaging simulation
- Building/optimising simulation pipelines (light source ‚Üí lens ‚Üí sensor ‚Üí image output)
- Supporting teams across hardware & software with optical simulation insights
- Running experiments to validate real-world vs simulated performance
- Partnering with internal optics experts + external vendors (e.g., ray tracing software providers)
- Performing diagnostics and image quality analysis



What You‚Äôll Work On (Day-to-Day)

- Design and optimise imaging simulation pipelines
- Build prototypes and tools for new camera technologies
- Evaluate design changes (e.g., bigger lens, new image sensor) before hardware is built
- Support Smart Glasses, AR, VR and ML/CV camera programs
- Own simulations that guide product-level decisions
- Analyse image quality (MTF, PSF, SNR, artifacts etc.)



Required Experience (Non-Negotiables)

For Role 1 ‚Äì Prototyping Engineer

- 8+ years in Python or Matlab
- Strong camera development experience
- Imaging design / image quality expertise



For Role 2 ‚Äì Software Engineer

- 8+ years in C++
- Strong background in camera systems
- Experience building simulation or imaging software



For both roles:

- Experience with imaging optics (lens behaviour, modeling, ray tracing)
- Experience with Code V / Zemax (or similar)
- Strong understanding of image formation: spectrum, aberrations, PSF, sampling, noise
- Ability to work independently end-to-end

Summary

We are seeking an experienced frontend design engineer to create a high-end marketing landing page (design already exists) with a strong focus on SEO and content management (currently deployed with sanity cms). The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of React and Next, and be able to design visually appealing and optimized landing pages with a high attention to detail, including micro-interactions and smooth transitions.



Tech stack and qualifications:

- Next, Tailwind v4
- Sanity CMS (open to moving to WordPress)
- HubSpot integration
- Resend for email delivery



Strong Bonus:

- Background with Programmatic SEO
- Background with GEO

job title: Cofounder HR & Operations @ AI Productivity SaaS Startup
description:
We‚Äôre building an AI productivity startup organized as a cooperative (shared ownership based on contribution). We‚Äôre looking for an additional Founder to join us as Chief of Operations & HR.



- HR: post roles, screen & shortlist, run brief brain-teaser interviews, onboard new teammates, run periodic ‚Äúhappiness‚Äù check-ins.
- Operations: source & set up tools/suppliers, basic bookkeeping & invoices (with accountant), keep docs tidy, Contribution accounting (track founders‚Äô work for fair equity/revenue share).



- Experience in HR / ops / admin (startup or small team ideal).
- Super achiever
- You want to be a real founder not only an early employee or freelancer with share options.



We operate as a cooperative startup, not a traditional hierarchy.

That means:

- You earn equity in the company based on your contribution.
- You share in revenue once clients or funding come in.
- Time commitment is flexible (starting at just 2 hours per week).
- Everyone on the team is a cofounder and has same rights.



You‚Äôll join an experienced, international group of founders from Germany, USA, India, and Egypt, working on next-generation AI tools for productivity and focus. We value autonomy, clarity, and collaboration ‚Äî and we‚Äôre building something that helps others work better too.



- You like making order out of chaos: write a checklist, test it, fix it, repeat.
- You‚Äôre OK with low cash now because you care about real ownership later.
- You value the spirit of a founder cooperative and you‚Äôre a team player.

- You need a salary today (cash is limited at the start).
- You need clear instructions and a chain of command.
- You want to do everything solo or prefer the coziness of corporate life.
- You‚Äôre not OK operating on a very low budget and getting things done scrappily.

Location

Fully remote: open to candidates in Germany as well as Europe more broadly, the UK, North America, South America, Australia, and New Zealand.



About the Role

Stellar AI is seeking experienced Software Engineers to contribute to projects across a wide range of technologies and programming languages, including JavaScript, Python, Go, C++, Ruby, and more.



This is an open-ended contract opportunity, structured around project-based work with no set schedules or minimum time / task commitments. Contributors who work with us decide which available projects they‚Äôd like to work on, when they work, and how much they contribute, which makes it an excellent option for those seeking flexible and high-impact work.



In this role, you will help advance AI research by understanding complex systems, exploring large codebases, and developing approaches to verify the correctness of software behavior.



Compensation

- 70 USD per hour after passing the qualifications

Responsibilities

- Rapidly build context in large, multi-module codebases
- Analyze feature implementations for correctness and edge cases
- Produce clear, structured documentation of findings and rationale

Requirements

- Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field
- 2+ years of experience as a Software Engineering
- Excellent written communication skills
- Ability to clearly explain complex technical concepts



About Stellar AI

We offer flexible, project-based work in data annotation and AI training. Our platform is designed for self-service. You can control your workflow, access resources as needed, and build valuable experience in the growing AI industry at your own pace.



Whether you're seeking supplemental income, hands-on experience with AI, or engaging challenges in a fast-growing field, Stellar gives you the flexibility to meaningfully contribute to creating the next generation of AI technology on your own terms.

Company Description

Hollywood UGC talent management firm specializing in partner acquisition, brand development, brand management, and social media management



Role Description

This is a remote contract role for a User Generated Content Producer for influencers and micro-influencing brands. The responsibilities include aspects of user-generated content production, coordinating video and multimedia creation, developing content strategies within stellar peaks entertainment, and managing content systems and workflows in collaboration with Stellar Peaks Entertainment. The role involves collaborating with different teams to ensure quality, creativity, and engagement in all content initiatives.



Qualifications

- Proficiency in Content Production and Video Production
- Familiarity with social media platforms and trends is a must
- Ability to develop and implement effective Content Strategy
- Strong Writing skills for content creation and communication
- Experience with Content Management systems and tools
- Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
- Ability to work independently and meet deadlines in a remote environment
- Influencer or micro-influencer status a plus

We are hiring freelance English speaking Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography .

This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, e.g., verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.

Requirements

- Full Professional Proficiency in English
- You must be living in United Kingdom the last 2 consecutive years
- Ability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website information
- You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in United Kingdom
- Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. Maps, News, Audio tasks, Relevance)
- Applicants must be 18 years or over.

Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.

tribe is on a mission to transition the world from online to offline - to help combat the growing loneliness epidemic.



Tribe's all-in-one platform supports a wide range of offline communities, including running, padel, wellness, art, and more. Much like how Shopify powers e-commerce, Tribe aims to be the leading platform for powering offline communities.



In addition to its B2B platform, Tribe has also created a B2C app that helps users discover and engage with local community events, fostering a more social lifestyle. Tribe's smart algorithm recommends relevant events to users, helping to grow the communities on the platform.



Check us out at www.tribeirl.com

This is a full-time remote role for a Senior Full Stack Engineer at tribe. The Senior Full Stack Engineer will be responsible for both back-end and front-end web development, software development, full-stack development, and CSS. - Back-End Web Development and Full-Stack Development skills
- Front-End Development and CSS skills

Typescript

Next.js

AWS

Flutter for our app

This role has the option to be remote or in-person at our beautiful offices in Lisbon where we have 3 tribe social clubs (co-working and events spaces). - We are happy to support with any relocation if required.

Trigyn has a contractual opportunity for a Security Operations Analyst. This resource will be working Remotely.



Job Description:



The incumbent will work under the supervision and guidance of the Head of Cyber Security

Operations to provide front-line support to client Partners in the area of information/cyber

security, risk management consulting, and security operations activities in collaboration with a team of information and cybersecurity experts.



The resource will be part of the 24x7 Security Operations Centre (CSOC) and will work in close collaboration with team members distributed around the globe to monitor, detect, triage, investigate and respond to cyber threats targeting its Clients and Partner Organizations.



Scope of Work / Duties of Consultant:

‚Ä¢ Monitor and investigate alerts leveraging Microsoft Security Tools (e.g. M365, Cloud App

Security, Azure, Defender for Endpoint, Azure Security, Azure Sentinel and XDR)

‚Ä¢ Monitor and triage AWS security events and detections

‚Ä¢ Monitor and investigate alerts leveraging EDR and NDR solutions

Review security events that are populated in a Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) system

‚Ä¢ Analyze a variety of network and host-based security appliance logs (Firewalls, NIDS, HIDS, Sys Logs, etc.) to determine the correct remediation actions and escalation paths for each incident

‚Ä¢ Identify the incident root cause and take proactive mitigation steps

‚Ä¢ Assist with incident response efforts

‚Ä¢ Follows precise analytical paths to determine the nature and extent of problems being reported by tools, e-mails, alerts, etc.

‚Ä¢ Integrate and share information with other analysts and other teams

‚Ä¢ Determine and direct remediation and recovery efforts.

‚Ä¢ Provide other ad hoc support as required



Required Technical Skills:

The resource MUST have the following skills and experience:

‚Ä¢ Knowledge of Transmission Control Protocol / Internet Protocol (TCP/IP) protocols

‚Ä¢ Deep knowledge of Microsoft Security Tools (e.g. M365, Cloud App Security, Azure, Defender for Endpoints, Azure Security, Azure Sentinel and XDR)

‚Ä¢ Deep Knowledge of Cloud technologies (e.g. Azure, AWS and GCP)

‚Ä¢ Deep knowledge of SIEM tools like Splunk, QRadar, ArcSight, MS Sentinel, ELK Stack

‚Ä¢ Knowledge of at least one EDR solution (MS Defender for Endpoint, SentinelOne, CrowdStrike)

‚Ä¢ Knowledge of email security, network monitoring, and incident response

‚Ä¢ Knowledge of Linux/Mac/Windows;

‚Ä¢ A minimum of five (5) years of relevant experience in the information technology field, including triage of alerts and supporting security incidents

‚Ä¢ Proven experience with the usual toolbox available in a SOC (e.g., SIEMs, EDRs), able to autonomously perform technical analysis of security threats and collaborate with the Incident Response team

‚Ä¢ Trouble ticket generation and processing experience

‚Ä¢ Extensive Windows, Linux, Database, Application, Web server, etc. log analysis

‚Ä¢ Expert knowledge of English, both written and spoken, is required



The resource SHOULD have the following skills and experience:

‚Ä¢ Experience on an Incident Response team performing Tier I/II initial incident triage.

‚Ä¢ Proven knowledge of monitoring AWS environment (IaaS, Saas, Paas)

‚Ä¢ Knowledge of at least one general-purpose or shell scripting language (e.g. Ruby, Bash, PowerShell, Python, etc.)



Required Soft Skills:

‚Ä¢ Excellent communication skills

‚Ä¢ Customer-facing experience and oral communication skills



Ability to write documentation & reports

‚Ä¢ Creativity/ ability to find innovative solutions

‚Ä¢ Willingness to learn on the job

‚Ä¢ Conflict management & cooperation



Desirable certifications:

‚Ä¢ Technical certifications: MCSE, CCNA, Microsoft Azure (e.g., SC-200), GCIH, CEH, GCFA or any GIAC/similar certification

‚Ä¢ Relevant industry certifications

description:
We are seeking a Principal / Architect of AI Systems ‚Äî a hands-on technical visionary who will define, accelerate, and unify all AI-related initiatives across the organization. This is not a people management role; it‚Äôs a deep technical leadership position focused on building, experimenting, and shaping the future of AI integration across our ecosystem.



This role blends research and implementation : part AI strategist, part hands-on builder, and part evangelist of best practices. The ideal candidate thrives on experimentation, stays ahead of emerging AI frameworks, and can translate innovation into production-grade systems that deliver real outcomes fast.



Core Responsibilities



Ô∏è Define and own the AI technical vision



- Set the overarching AI architecture and ensure consistency across teams and products.
- Guide how AI is designed, coded, tested, and deployed organization-wide.



Stay on the bleeding edge



- Spend ~50% of time exploring emerging models, frameworks, and paradigms (LLMs, agents, orchestration layers, etc.).
- Identify opportunities for innovation and translate research into tangible prototypes.



Build, validate, and ship



- Dedicate the other 50% to hands-on development ‚Äî building prototypes, validating architectures, and accelerating AI integration across projects.
- Design and test agentic systems, model orchestration layers, and AI infrastructure patterns.



Evaluate and select technologies



- Drive tool selection for LLMs, frameworks, vector databases, embeddings, retrieval systems, and orchestration layers (LangChain, Bedrock, Azure OpenAI, etc.).
- Balance innovation with reliability, cost, and scalability.



Accelerate delivery cadence

- Champion rapid experimentation cycles ‚Äî moving beyond slow, traditional sprints toward daily or near-daily delivery of AI outcomes.
- Instill a culture of visible, continuous improvement in AI development.



Standardize best practices



- Define how AI coding, testing, and deployment should be done across the company.
- Establish reusable templates, pipelines, and architecture patterns.



Mentor and evangelize



- Coach engineers and architects on responsible AI integration.
- Promote AI literacy and best practices across cross-functional teams.





Ideal Background



- 10+ years in software architecture, ML systems , or AI platform engineering .
- Proven experience with LLM integration , agentic systems , and AI infrastructure .
- Deep technical fluency with tools such as LangChain, Azure OpenAI, AWS Bedrock, Vector DBs, RAG pipelines , and MLOps workflows .
- Strong foundation in data engineering , DevOps , and AI system orchestration .
- Demonstrated ability to ship prototypes fast ‚Äî not just theorize, but deliver.
- Track record of research-driven innovation and constant exploration of new models and frameworks.





Key Mindset & Attributes



- Research-Driven Builder: Obsessed with learning, testing, and applying the newest AI advances.
- Execution-Oriented: Moves fast, experiments intelligently, and delivers tangible results.
- Anti-Bureaucracy: Rejects unnecessary process; favors agility and iteration.
- Cross-Functional Connector: Works fluidly with data, cloud, and app teams to unify vision.
- Thought Leader: Defines standards, drives technical discipline, and inspires AI excellence across projects.



Ideal Candidate Profile



A Principal AI Architect or Staff-level AI Engineer who combines strategic vision with hands-on execution ‚Äî capable of setting technical direction , architecting cutting-edge systems, and keeping the organization at the forefront of applied AI innovation.
